cards.name: Thundersong Trumpeter
cards.text: {T}: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Hear that? Those notes mean we've arrived at Sunhome! Let our allies' hearts soar and our enemies' hearts shatter at the sound!"
—Klattic, Boros legionnaire
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.

cards.name: Tolsimir Wolfblood
cards.text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Create a legendary 2/2 green and white Wolf creature token named Voja.

rulings.text: Other creatures you control that are both green and white, including Voja, get +2/+2.
The token is named "Voja" and has creature type "Wolf." This is different from most creature tokens, where the name and creature type are the same.

The "legend rule" means that creating a second Voja while one is already under your control will result in one of them being put into its owner's graveyard (where it promptly ceases to exist). You choose which of the two remains on the battlefield and which is put into the graveyard.

foreignNames.name: トルシミール・ウルフブラッド

cards.originalText:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Put a legendary 2/2 green and white Wolf creature token named Voja into play.

cards.name: Twisted Justice
cards.text: Target player sacrifices a creature. You draw cards equal to that creature's power.
cards.flavor: In Otiev's mind, he ruled in favor of the accused. But in his courtroom he was only a spectator, watching his hand deliver the sign of death.
cards.originalText: Target player sacrifices a creature. You draw cards equal to that creature's power.

cards.name: Vulturous Zombie
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Vulturous Zombie.
cards.flavor:
"When something dies, all things benefit. Well okay, just our things."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

rulings.text: The ability doesn't care why a card goes to your opponent's graveyard — only that it does. The ability triggers when a card is put into your opponent's graveyard from the stack (a spell resolves, fails to resolve, or is countered), from the battlefield (a permanent is destroyed or sacrificed), from the player's hand (a card is discarded), from the player's library (from a Millstone-like effect), or from any other zone.
This ability triggers only on cards, so it won't trigger when a token is put into your opponent's graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Vulturous Zombie.

cards.name: Watchwolf
cards.flavor: Only in Ravnica do the wolves watch the flock.

cards.name: Woodwraith Corrupter
cards.text: {1}{B}{G}, {T}: Target Forest becomes a 4/4 black and green Elemental Horror creature. It's still a land.
cards.flavor:
"Its darkened sap penetrates natural fibers and spreads its own genes. Emulation experiments are underway."
—Simic research notes

rulings.text: The effect has no stated duration, so a land turned into a creature this way continues being a creature as long as the land is on the battlefield.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {1}{B}{G}, {T}: Target Forest becomes a 4/4 black and green Elemental Horror creature. It's still a land.

cards.name: Woodwraith Strangler
cards.text: Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Regenerate Woodwraith Strangler.
cards.flavor:
"Nothing could be more natural than roots sucking nourishment from the dead."
—Savra
cards.originalText: Remove a creature card in your graveyard from the game: Regenerate Woodwraith Strangler.

cards.name: Boros Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: ボロスのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
({R/W} can be paid with either {R} or {W}.)
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

({R/W} can be paid with either {R} or {W}.)

cards.flavor:
"Look at this goblin, once wild, untamed, and full of idiocy. The Boros have given him the skill of a soldier and focused his heart with a single cause."
—Razia
cards.originalText:
({R/W} can be paid with either {R} or {W}.)

cards.flavor: Swift, strong, and selfless, the centaurs are the shields of the Conclave.

cards.originalText:
({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)
When Centaur Safeguard is put into a graveyard from play, you may gain 3 life.

cards.name: Dimir Guildmage
cards.text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
{3}{B}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

foreignNames.name: ディミーアのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.
{3}{B}: Target player discards a card. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Gaze of the Gorgon
cards.text:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Regenerate target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.
cards.flavor: Even the dead give way to the mineral gaze of the gorgon.

rulings.text: At the next end of combat step in the turn, all creatures that had blocked the targeted creature at any point during the turn will be destroyed. This includes creatures that blocked it before Gaze of the Gorgon was cast. It doesn't matter whether the targeted creature is still on the battlefield at that point.

cards.originalText:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Regenerate target creature. At end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by that creature this turn.

cards.name: Gleancrawler
cards.text:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Trample
At the beginning of your end step, return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.

rulings.text: When this ability resolves, it returns all creature cards currently in your graveyard that were put there directly from the battlefield sometime during the turn. This includes cards that were put into your graveyard before Gleancrawler entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Trample
At the end of your turn, return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put into your graveyard from play this turn.

cards.text:
{4}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
{4}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
{4}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
{4}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Lurking Informant
cards.text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
{2}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: In the undercity, forgetfulness is often encouraged at the point of a blade.
cards.originalText:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
{2}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Master Warcraft
cards.text:
Cast this spell only before attackers are declared.
You choose which creatures attack this turn.
You choose which creatures block this turn and how those creatures block.

rulings.text: You choose attackers and make blocking assignments regardless of whether it's your turn and regardless of whether the creatures are attacking you. Your choices must be legal within the normal rules for attacking and blocking.
You can decide that a creature won't block.

If the defending player controls a planeswalker, the person who cast Master Warcraft first chooses the complete group of creatures that are going to attack. Then, for each of those creatures, the active player chooses who or what it's going to attack.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

foreignNames.name: Maîtrise de l'art de la guerre

cards.originalText:
({R/W} can be paid with either {R} or {W}.)
Play Master Warcraft only before attackers are declared.
You choose which creatures attack this turn. You choose how each creature blocks this turn.

cards.name: Privileged Position
cards.text:
({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)
Other permanents you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.originalText:
({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)
Other permanents you control can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.

cards.name: Selesnya Guildmage
cards.text:
{3}{G}: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
{3}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)
{3}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.
{3}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shadow of Doubt
cards.text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
Players can't search libraries this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Your ignorance is my bliss."
—Szadek

rulings.text: If an effect says "You may search your library . . . If you do, shuffle your library," you can't choose to search since it's impossible, and you won't shuffle.
If an effect says "Search your library . . . Then shuffle your library," the search effect fails, but you will have to shuffle.

Since players can't search, players won't be able to find any cards in a library. The effect applies to all players and all libraries. If a spell or ability's effect has other parts that don't depend on searching for or finding cards, they will still work normally.
Effects that tell a player to reveal cards from a library or look at cards from the top of a library will still work. Only effects that use the word "search" will fail.

cards.originalText:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
Players can't search libraries this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Bloodletter Quill
cards.text:
{2}, {T}, Put a blood counter on Bloodletter Quill: Draw a card, then you lose 1 life for each blood counter on Bloodletter Quill.
{U}{B}: Remove a blood counter from Bloodletter Quill.

rulings.text: You may activate the second ability in response to activating the first one. If you do, you'll remove the blood counter that was just added before you lose the life.

cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}, Put a blood counter on Bloodletter Quill: Draw a card, then lose 1 life for each blood counter on Bloodletter Quill.
{U}{B}: Remove a blood counter from Bloodletter Quill.

cards.name: Boros Signet
cards.flavor:
"Have you ever held a Boros signet? There's a weight to it that belies its size—a weight of strength and of pride."
—Agrus Kos
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bottled Cloister
cards.text:
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, exile all cards from your hand face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return all cards you own exiled with Bottled Cloister to your hand, then draw a card.

rulings.text: Errata'd to make it clear that only the cards you own go into your hand, so if you somehow gain control of the Cloister, your opponent's cards won't go to your hand.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, remove your hand from the game face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return all cards removed from the game with Bottled Cloister to your hand, then draw a card.

cards.name: Cloudstone Curio
cards.text: Whenever a nonartifact permanent enters the battlefield under your control, you may return another permanent you control that shares a permanent type with it to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It wants to remain a mystery, banishing the curious in favor of less inquisitive company.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nonartifact permanent comes into play under your control, you may return another permanent you control that shares a permanent type with it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Crown of Convergence
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is a creature card, creatures you control that share a color with that card get +1/+1.
{G}{W}: Put the top card of your library on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: A colorless creature on top of your library never gives a bonus, and a colorless creature on the battlefield never gets a bonus.
The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
When playing with the top card of your library revealed, if an effect tells you to draw several cards, reveal each one before you draw it.

cards.originalText:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is a creature card, creatures you control that share a color with that card get +1/+1.
{G}{W}: Put the top card of your library on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Cyclopean Snare
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature, then return Cyclopean Snare to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The spoiled, gluttonous halls of the Orzhov teem with gaudy, needless wealth. Even their security measures are made for beauty first, efficiency second.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature, then return Cyclopean Snare to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Dimir Signet
cards.flavor: An emblem of a secret guild, the Dimir insignia is seen only by its own members—and the doomed.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Glass Golem
cards.flavor: Izzet artificers have learned to steer their beautiful constructs clear of Boros warhammers—and the opera house.

cards.name: Golgari Signet
cards.flavor: Depending on your point of view, the seal represents a proud guardian of the natural cycle or one who has sold her soul to darkness for eternal life.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {B}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Grifter's Blade
cards.text:
Flash
As Grifter's Blade enters the battlefield, choose a creature you control it could be attached to. If you do, it enters the battlefield attached to that creature.
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1}

rulings.text: Grifter's Blade must enter the battlefield attached to a creature you control, if possible.
If you don't control a creature Grifter's Blade could be attached to, it simply enters the battlefield unattached.

cards.originalText:
You may play Grifter's Blade any time you could play an instant.
Grifter's Blade comes into play equipping a creature of your choice you control.
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1}

cards.name: Junktroller
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: One man's trash is another man's troller.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Put target card in a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.name: Leashling
cards.text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: Return Leashling to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Constructed of leather and irony.
cards.originalText: Put a card in your hand on top of your library: Return Leashling to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Nullstone Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever the first noncreature spell of a turn is cast, counter that spell.
cards.flavor: Nullstone absorbs and dampens most forms of magical energy, as well as light, sound, and heat.

rulings.text: Nullstone Gargoyle cares about the first noncreature spell cast during a turn, not the first one it "sees." If a noncreature spell was cast before Nullstone Gargoyle entered the battlefield, it won't counter the next one.
If another spell is cast in response to the first spell, Nullstone Gargoyle doesn't affect that second spell.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever the first noncreature spell each turn is played, counter that spell.

cards.name: Pariah's Shield
cards.text:
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to equipped creature instead.
Equip {3}
cards.flavor: To bear the shield of the pariah is the highest honor a Boros can receive—and the last.

rulings.text: If Pariah's Shield isn't attached to a creature, all damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to you normally.

cards.originalText:
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to equipped creature instead.
Equip {3}

cards.name: Peregrine Mask
cards.text:
Equipped creature has defender, flying, and first strike.
Equip {2}
cards.flavor: The mask confers both the prowess of a falcon and its loyalty.
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature has defender, flying, and first strike.
Equip {2}

cards.name: Plague Boiler
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a plague counter on Plague Boiler.
{1}{B}{G}: Put a plague counter on Plague Boiler or remove a plague counter from it.
When Plague Boiler has three or more plague counters on it, sacrifice it. If you do, destroy all nonland permanents.

rulings.text: You choose whether to add or remove a counter when the second ability resolves. You can't choose to remove a counter if there isn't one there.

If the third ability triggers, removing a counter in response won't stop the effect. However, somehow removing Plague Boiler from the battlefield in response would stop the effect because then you wouldn't be able to sacrifice Plague Boiler.
The sacrifice is done on resolution of the triggered ability.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a plague counter on Plague Boiler.
{1}{B}{G}: Put a plague counter on Plague Boiler or remove a plague counter from it.
When Plague Boiler has three or more plague counters on it, sacrifice it. If you do, destroy all nonland permanents.

cards.name: Selesnya Signet
cards.flavor: The symbol of the Conclave is one of unity, with tree supporting sun and sun feeding tree.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Spectral Searchlight
cards.text: {T}: Choose a player. That player adds one mana of any color they choose.
cards.flavor: The first searchlights were given as gifts, symbols of cooperation, to the emissaries present at the signing of the Guildpact.

rulings.text: You may choose yourself.

cards.originalText: {T}: Choose a player. That player adds one mana of any color he or she chooses to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Sunforger

rulings.text: You can't pay the cost of the second ability unless Sunforger is attached to a creature.

Any card you find must be legally castable (for example, you have to be able to choose a legal target for it). If you can't find a castable card (or choose not to), nothing happens and you shuffle your library.

The card is cast from your library, not your hand. You choose modes, pay additional costs, choose targets, etc. for the spell as normal when casting it. Any X in the mana cost will be 0. Alternative costs can't be paid.

cards.name: Terrarion
cards.text:
Terrarion enters the battlefield tapped.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Terrarion: Add two mana in any combination of colors.
When Terrarion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

rulings.text: You can get either two mana of the same color or one mana each of different colors.
You get the mana before you draw the card.
You draw a card no matter how Terrarion winds up in a graveyard from the battlefield.
You must choose the colors of mana Terrarion produces before its last ability has you draw a card.
Terrarion's last ability triggers no matter how it's put into a graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Terrarion comes into play tapped.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Terrarion: Add two mana of any combination of colors to your mana pool.
When Terrarion is put into a graveyard from play, draw a card.

cards.name: Voyager Staff
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice Voyager Staff: Exile target creature. Return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Voyager staffs are sought by those hoping to find an escape from the sprawling glut of Ravnica.
cards.originalText: {2}, Sacrifice Voyager Staff: Remove target creature from the game. Return that creature to play under its owner's control at end of turn.

cards.name: Boros Garrison
cards.text:
Boros Garrison enters the battlefield tapped.
When Boros Garrison enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {R}{W}.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.originalText:
Boros Garrison comes into play tapped.
When Boros Garrison comes into play, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.text:
Dimir Aqueduct enters the battlefield tapped.
When Dimir Aqueduct enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {U}{B}.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.originalText:
Dimir Aqueduct comes into play tapped.

{T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{U}{B}, {T}: Target player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: In a space where there is no room, in a structure that was never built, meets the guild that doesn't exist.

Manto do Crepúsculo, Casa das Sombras

{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.text:
Golgari Rot Farm enters the battlefield tapped.
When Golgari Rot Farm enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {B}{G}.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.originalText:
Golgari Rot Farm comes into play tapped.
When Golgari Rot Farm comes into play, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {B}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Overgrown Tomb
cards.text:
({T}: Add {B} or {G}.)
As Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.

If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

cards.originalText:
({T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.)
As Overgrown Tomb comes into play, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Overgrown Tomb comes into play tapped instead.

cards.name: Sacred Foundry
cards.text:
({T}: Add {R} or {W}.)
As Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Sacred Foundry enters the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.

If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

cards.originalText:
({T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.)
As Sacred Foundry comes into play, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Sacred Foundry comes into play tapped instead.

cards.name: Selesnya Sanctuary
cards.text:
Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield tapped.
When Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {G}{W}.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.originalText:
Selesnya Sanctuary comes into play tapped.
When Selesnya Sanctuary comes into play, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Sunhome—the stalwart shield, the towering sentinel, the seat of justice.

rulings.text: If you give double strike to a creature with first strike after first-strike combat damage has been dealt, that creature will also deal damage during the normal combat damage step.
If you give double strike to a creature after either first-strike or normal combat damage has been dealt, it won't help that creature deal any additional combat damage.

foreignNames.name: Morada do Sol, Fortaleza da Legião
Casa Solar, base de la Legión

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Svogthos, the Restless Tomb
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

rulings.text: While animated, Svogthos's power and toughness changes each time a creature card enters or leaves its controller's graveyard.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

foreignNames.name: 安息の無い墓、スヴォグトース

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

cards.name: Temple Garden
cards.text:
({T}: Add {G} or {W}.)
As Temple Garden enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Temple Garden enters the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Has basic land types, but isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. For example, you can't find it with Civic Wayfinder.
If another effect (such as Loxodon Gatekeeper's ability) tells you to put lands onto the battlefield tapped, it enters the battlefield tapped whether you pay 2 life or not.

If multiple permanents with "as enters the battlefield" effects are entering the battlefield at the same time, process those effects one at a time, then put the permanents onto the battlefield all at once. For example, if you're at 3 life and an effect puts two of these onto the battlefield, you can pay 2 life for only one of them, not both.

cards.originalText:
({T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.)
As Temple Garden comes into play, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Temple Garden comes into play tapped instead.

cards.name: Vitu-Ghazi, the City-Tree
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}{G}{W}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: In the autumn, she casts her seeds across the streets below, and come spring, her children rise in service to the Conclave.

cards.name: Aura Blast
cards.text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "None of your history books mention me?" laughed Daria. "They will now."

rulings.text: You don't draw a card if this spell is countered or if the target is illegal on resolution.
You still draw a card if the enchantment regenerates.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target enchantment.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Aurora Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{W}: Target permanent becomes white until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though a fierce fighter, its true value is that it inspires beleaguered forces.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}: Target permanent becomes white until end of turn.

cards.name: Disciple of Kangee
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Target creature gains flying and becomes blue until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When no birds are available, Kangee's disciples fill the sky with anything that's willing to fight.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Target creature gains flying and becomes blue until end of turn.

cards.name: Dominaria's Judgment
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain protection from white if you control a Plains, from blue if you control an Island, from black if you control a Swamp, from red if you control a Mountain, and from green if you control a Forest.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain protection from white if you control a plains, from blue if you control an island, from black if you control a swamp, from red if you control a mountain, and from green if you control a forest.

cards.name: Guard Dogs
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}: Choose a permanent you control. Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn if it shares a color with that permanent.
cards.flavor:
"A good guard is alert. A great guard is also loyal."
—Benalish kennelmaster

rulings.text: You choose the target on activation and choose the permanent which is compared for color on resolution.
You only check colors on resolution and not later when the damage prevention actually is applied.

cards.originalText: {2}{W}, {T}: Choose a permanent you control. Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn if it shares a color with that permanent.

cards.name: Heroic Defiance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 unless it shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common.
cards.flavor:
"Wear courage as your armor. Wield honor as your blade."
—Gerrard
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 unless it shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common.

cards.name: Hobble
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Hobble enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Enchanted creature can't block if it's black.
cards.originalText:
When Hobble comes into play, draw a card.
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Enchanted creature can't block if it's black.

cards.name: Honorable Scout
cards.text: When Honorable Scout enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each black and/or red creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "I've faced your kind before. This time I'm ready for you."

rulings.text: If a creature is both black and red, you gain 2 life, not 4.

cards.originalText: When Honorable Scout comes into play, you gain 2 life for each black and/or red creature target opponent controls.

cards.name: Lashknife Barrier
cards.text:
When Lashknife Barrier enters the battlefield, draw a card.
If a source would deal damage to a creature you control, it deals that much damage minus 1 to that creature instead.
cards.originalText:
When Lashknife Barrier comes into play, draw a card.
If a source would deal damage to a creature you control, it deals that much damage minus 1 to that creature instead.

cards.name: March of Souls
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Orim's Chant
cards.text:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you cast this spell.)
Target player can't cast spells this turn. If this spell was kicked, creatures can't attack this turn.

rulings.text: This spell does nothing to creatures which are already attacking. It does not remove attacking creatures from combat.
This spell does not affect the abilities of permanents. It only affects spells.
This can't be used as a counterspell. It will have no effect on spells which were on the stack when it was cast, nor on those cast in response to it.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you play this spell.)
Target player can't play spells this turn.
If you paid the kicker cost, creatures can't attack this turn.

cards.name: Planeswalker's Mirth
cards.text: {3}{W}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from their hand. You gain life equal to that card's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"I enjoy a good joke as much as the next guy."
—Commodore Guff

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, then no life is gained.

cards.originalText: {3}{W}: Target opponent reveals a card at random from his or her hand. You gain life equal to that card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Pollen Remedy
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of targets, divided as you choose. If this spell was kicked, prevent the next 6 damage this way instead.

rulings.text: You can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and 3 (or 6) targets.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose. If you paid the kicker cost, prevent the next 6 damage this way instead.

cards.name: Samite Elder
cards.text: {T}: Creatures you control gain protection from the colors of target permanent you control until end of turn.

rulings.text: If the color of that permanent changes after the ability takes effect, the color of protection that was granted does not change.
The color is determined on resolution.

cards.originalText: {T}: Creatures you control gain protection from the color(s) of target permanent you control until end of turn.

cards.name: Samite Pilgrim
cards.text: Domain — {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.name: Sunscape Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} as you cast this spell.)
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{G} kicker, destroy target creature with flying.
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, draw two cards.

cards.name: Sunscape Familiar
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Green spells and blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: The spirits of fallen battlemages can serve their guilds as familiars by joining with any physical form.

rulings.text: If a spell is both green and blue, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Green spells and blue spells you play cost {1} less to play.

cards.name: Surprise Deployment
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat.
You may put a nonwhite creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. At the beginning of the next end step, return that creature to your hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText:
Play Surprise Deployment only during combat.
Put a nonwhite creature card from your hand into play. At end of turn, return that creature to your hand. (Return it only if it's in play.)

cards.name: Voice of All
cards.text:
Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
Flying
As Voice of All comes into play, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.

cards.name: Allied Strategies
cards.text: Domain — Target player draws a card for each basic land type among lands they control.
cards.flavor: Each commander looked at the others and wondered who would be first to break the alliance.

rulings.text: You draw one card per basic land type, not for each basic land. This makes it a maximum of 5 cards.

To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Target player draws a card for each basic land type among lands he or she controls.

cards.name: Arctic Merfolk
cards.text:
Kicker—Return a creature you control to its owner's hand. (You may return a creature you control to its owner's hand in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Arctic Merfolk was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Kicker—Return a creature you control to its owner's hand. (You may return a creature you control to its owner's hand in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Arctic Merfolk comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Confound
cards.text:
Counter target spell that targets a creature.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Did I know Szat would betray us?" Urza asked quizzically. "I was counting on it."

rulings.text: Confound doesn't resolve if the targeted spell has been countered or does not still target one or more permanents that are still creatures and are still on the battlefield. Confound is different from other such spells in that it actually specifies that the spell must target a creature, not just be able to target a creature or that the spell has a certain number of targets.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell that targets one or more creatures.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Dralnu's Pet
cards.text:
Kicker—{2}{B}, Discard a creature card. (You may pay {2}{B} and discard a creature card in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Dralnu's Pet was kicked, it enters the battlefield with flying and with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If the Dralnu's Pet is kicked, Dralnu's Pet will have flying from the moment it enters the battlefield. This will trigger abilities that look for a creature with flying entering the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Kicker—{2}{B}, Discard a creature card from your hand. (You may pay {2}{B} and discard a creature card from your hand in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Dralnu's Pet has flying and comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Ertai's Trickery
cards.text: Counter target spell if it was kicked.
cards.flavor: "Don't worry, Gerrard," said Ertai. "I'm sure the crew will come to your rescue as quickly as they came to mine."

rulings.text: You can target any spell, but that spell will be countered only if it was kicked.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell if a kicker cost was paid for it.

cards.name: Escape Routes
cards.text: {2}{U}: Return target white or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"I'll get you to safety—or whatever passes for safety these days."
—Urborg ferry pilot
cards.originalText: {2}{U}: Return target white or black creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Gainsay
cards.text: Counter target blue spell.
cards.flavor:
"I'd be happy to stop contradicting you, Urza, just as soon as you start being right."
—Bo Levar, planeswalker
cards.originalText: Counter target blue spell.

cards.name: Hunting Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Hunting Drake enters the battlefield, put target red or green creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Even the fiercest beast will flee when faced with the possibility of becoming dinner.

rulings.text: If the target changes color from red to green or green to red between triggering and resolution, the ability still works.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Hunting Drake comes into play, put target red or green creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Planar Overlay
cards.text: Each player chooses a land they control of each basic land type. Return those lands to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The Phyrexians don't want to conquer Dominaria. They want to remake it.

rulings.text: If you have a land which counts as multiple land types, you can choose that land as each of those types. For example, a dual land could be chosen as two of your land types.

cards.originalText: Each player chooses a land he or she controls of each basic land type. Return those lands to their owners' hands.
